intro: Tylophora calcarata, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, orchid-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a waxy texture, while the flowers display a range of colors from white to pink. Tylophora calcarata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
